Posted By: EpicBroccoli (6/18/2011 7:28:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Afterlife isn't a bad card in EDH. It's instant-speed, fairly-cheap, unconditional removal. You'll most likely be killing a creature that costs more than three mana, and a single 1/1 token doesn't amount to anything in that format.
  
   
The problem is that it's white; that color already has the best single-shot removal in the game. When card advantage is of high importance, it's best to keep the one-for-one removal spells to a minimum. It's hard for Afterlife when it has to compete against [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile), [Condemn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Condemn), and [Wing Shards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wing Shards). There's just no room left for it.
  
   
The card would have been awesome, were it printed in red, green, or blue.
posts.html:
Afterlife isn't a bad card in EDH. It's instant-speed, fairly-cheap, unconditional removal. You'll most likely be killing a creature that costs more than three mana, and a single 1/1 token doesn't amount to anything in that format.

The problem is that it's white; that color already has the best single-shot removal in the game. When card advantage is of high importance, it's best to keep the one-for-one removal spells to a minimum. It's hard for Afterlife when it has to compete against Swords to Plowshares, Path to Exile, Condemn, and Wing Shards. There's just no room left for it.

The card would have been awesome, were it printed in red, green, or blue.

Posted By: BastianQoU (10/8/2011 9:39:16 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Awesome white removal. Cheap, instant and easy to splash if you're playing multiple colors.  
  
Protip: Use it in a token deck! If your opponent tries to [Maelstrom Pulse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maelstrom Pulse)/[Echoing Decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Echoing Decay) your [Spectral Procession](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spectral Procession) token, simply destroy it and get another token to make your opponent's spell fizzle :D  
  
No, but seriously, this is a pretty good alternative if you can't get your hands on [Unmake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unmake) or [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares)-ish cards.
posts.html:
Awesome white removal. Cheap, instant and easy to splash if you're playing multiple colors.

Protip: Use it in a token deck! If your opponent tries to Maelstrom Pulse/Echoing Decay your Spectral Procession token, simply destroy it and get another token to make your opponent's spell fizzle :D

No, but seriously, this is a pretty good alternative if you can't get your hands on Unmake or Swords to Plowshares-ish cards.
